official-title.#text:
To require the collection of up-to-date information on
		  tariff and non-tariff laws, regulations, and practices of foreign countries
		  affecting exports of United States goods and services, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Transparent Rules Allow Direct
			 Exporting for Small Businesses and Jobs Act

TRADE for Small Businesses and Jobs
			 Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Foreign tariff and
			 non-tariff laws, regulations, and practices affecting exports of United States
			 goods and services

text.#text:
The purpose of this section is to assist
			 exporters of United States goods and services to access new markets in foreign
			 countries.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, collect information on changes in tariff and non-tariff
			 laws, regulations, and practices of foreign countries affecting exports of
			 United States goods and services other than United States agricultural
			 commodities.

shall make available the information
			 collected under

to United States exporters on the Web site
			 Export.gov or a successor Web site.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparent Rules Allow Direct Exporting for Small Businesses and Jobs Act/s:2/ss:b

text.#text:
Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment
			 of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall be presented in a clear and
			 easy-to-understand format to allow United States exporters to better understand
			 and comply with tariff and non-tariff laws, regulations, and practices of
			 foreign countries described in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Transparent Rules Allow Direct Exporting for Small Businesses and Jobs Act/s:2/ss:b
Transparent Rules Allow Direct Exporting for Small Businesses and Jobs Act/s:2/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall update the
			 information collected under

on the Web site Export.gov or a
			 successor Web site not less than once every 60 days after the date on which the
